entry.dcterms:title: European Election Study 1988-1989, Wave II. Political preferences among the population of the European Community.
entry.dcterms:creator: Merkl, Ildikó
entry.dcterms:subject: TÁRKI Joint Research Center TDATA-C95: European Election Study 1988-1989, Wave II. Political preferences among the population of the European Community.. data sheet. Version: 2009-09-11
entry.dcterms:creator: Eijk, Cees van der
Oppenhus, Erik
Schmitt, Hermann
entry.dcterms:contributor: Dutch Institute for Scientific Information Services Steinmetz Archive
Central Archive for Empirical Social Research
entry.dcterms:description: voting intentions, selection of parties in own country and Europe; mobilising European electoral campaign, participation and evaluation; opinions on the "EUROPESTATE", European Parliament, EEC, common European market, competence and efficiency of parties; interest in politics, parties taking right and left sides, opinions on political events, participation in them, their social backgrounds
entry.dcterms:subject: science and technology
international politics and organisations
political institutions, public administration
elections
entry.dcterms:coverage: Belgium, Denmark, France, Germany, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Luxemburg, Netherlands, Portugal, Spain, United Kingdom
entry.dcterms:subject: persons and households
survey data
time-series

EEC member countries participated in the investigation. Data on Northern Ireland were taken separately. Appr. 1000 persons were interviewed in each country, at three differemt times before and after the Europe Parliament elections. This is three independent random samples of the citizens of the member countries.
data collection with questionnaire
B
